result.execSummary:
The defendant Shavaugn L Cole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/28/22.

miscConds.notes:
Complete Parenting Classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
Contact with the victim pursuant to DMCPS/CHIPS order.
Cooperate with CHIPS orders in cases 22JC193 - 197.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
Court set restitution at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shavaugn L Cole

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shavaugn L Cole in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Shavaugn L Cole.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 1 AND 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, 5, AND 6: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 2 days served. 

AS TO COUNT 4: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 2 days served. 

AS TO COUNT 5: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 2 days served. 

AS TO COUNT 6: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 2 days served. 

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Contact with the victim pursuant to DMCPS/CHIPS order.
- Cooperate with CHIPS orders in cases 22JC193 - 197.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/28/22.

Received and filed: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Defendant Shavaugn L Cole appeared by video.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs appeared by video for Shavaugn L Cole.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons put forth on the record. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shavaugn L Cole in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case reassigned to Branch 29, Judge Kiefer.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 17 pages) commencing  06-06-2022 by KAITLYN EDWARDS .

Defendant Shavaugn L Cole in court, appear by video with attorney Arial Rosenberg appear by video for Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J.Tryan.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
All conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Defendant Shavaugn L Cole in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared  in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Warrant is canceled.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 5000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Shavaugn L Cole not in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing.  State witness was present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Court ordered no contact with DL, JL.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
 Defendant is ordered not to have any discussion about this case to any of the named victims or witnesses named in the criminal complaint.

Defendant Shavaugn L Cole in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Shavaugn L Cole in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
